title: Angelina Jolie is a goddess as she radiates happiness at Maleficent photocall
text:
Ange was ruling Monday morning (Picture: REUTERS)

Angelina Jolie has left her usual black outfits on the shelf in favour of an amazing purple, butterfly-esque design for a Maleficent photocall this week.

Posing alongside co-star Michelle Pfeiffer, 61, the mother-of-five radiated all the happiness during the event at Rome’s Hotel De La Ville.

We’re used to seeing the 44-year-old clad in black, a red carpet and off-duty favourite over the years, but today she opted for a purple, cascading, pleated shirt with spaghetti straps and we’re in love.

She sported a massive grin, leaving her long hair softly curled and billowing over one shoulder for snaps ahead of the cinematic release.

The magnificent (or maleficent?) top was paired with a pair of sleek black trousers and ankle-strap stilettos as she strutted across the roof for the shoot.

Five years after first donning the evil fairy’s horns in 2014, Ange returns as Maleficent in soon-to-be-released Mistress Of Evil, this time fighting for the love of Princess Aurora (Elle Fanning).

She meets her match in the form of Queen Ingrith (played by Michelle) who causes drama of explosive proportions when her son Prince Phillip proposes to Aurora.

They’re spectacular (Picture: AFP)

We love everything about this outfit (Picture: AFP)

Ahead of the release, Ange has spoken about the similarities between her own struggles and that of Maleficent’s, referencing the breakdown of her marriage to Brad Pitt in 2016.

Brad and Angelina got married in 2014 and quickly became one of Hollywood’s most beloved couples, before splitting two years later, 11 years after they first started dating.

When asked last week if she believed in fate, she explained: ‘I don’t what my fate holds but what I am convinced of is that I am in a period of transition, like a return to my roots, a return to myself. Because, I had lost myself a bit.’

Sorry, this video isn't available any more.

Ange stars at the evil fairy (Picture: Disney Enterprises, Inc)

Clarifying, she added: ‘I think it happened as my relationship with Brad was coming to an end, then at the beginning of our separation. It was a complicated moment, where I didn’t recognise myself anymore, where I had become… how can I say… smaller, almost insignificant, even if it wasn’t necessarily visible.

Advertisement

Advertisement

‘I felt a deep and genuine sadness, I was hurt. On the other hand, it was interesting to reconnect with this humility and even this insignificance I was feeling. Maybe this is what being human is in the end… On top of all this, I suffered some health issues. All these things settle in you and remind you of how lucky you are of being alive.’

Speaking to French magazine Madame, the mum-of-six went on to say that rediscovering joy is a lesson she wants to teach her children.

Maleficent: Mistress Of Evil is in UK cinemas 18 October.
